subcategories.content:
Hajj conditions are divided into two parts:
1. Validity Conditions
Islam: Hajj is only valid from a Muslim.
2. Obligation Conditions
Adulthood: Required for adults. Minors' Hajj is valid but doesn't fulfill the obligation.
Reason: Required for sane persons. Insane person's Hajj is valid but doesn't fulfill obligation.
Freedom: Required for free people, not slaves.
Capability: Physical, financial, and security capability to reach Mecca.
Women's Condition: Must have husband or mahram, or safe company.
Note: If conditions met, Hajj becomes obligatory once in lifetime.

Spiritual and material preparation:

Spiritual:
- Sincere repentance
- Pay debts and return rights
- Learn Hajj rulings
- Attend scholars' gatherings

Material:
- Prepare sufficient expenses
- Ensure physical health
- Prepare documents (passport, visa)
- Pack appropriate clothing and ihram
- Prepare necessary medicines
- Carry umbrella for sun protection

Pilgrim should be humble with good manners.

Recommended to multiply supplications:

Travel supplications:
- 'In the name of Allah, I trust in Allah'
- 'O Allah, I ask You in this journey for piety'
- 'O Allah, ease this journey for us'

Boarding plane:
- 'Praise be to Allah who has subjected this to us'

Pilgrim should multiply prayers upon the Prophet.

Pilgrim should carry:

Documents:
- Valid passport
- Official Hajj permit
- ID card
- Extra photos

Finances:
- Sufficient money
- Bank cards

Ihram clothing:
- White Izar and Rida (men)
- White undergarments

Hygiene items:
- Personal towels
- Soap and shampoo
- Toothbrush
- Nail clipper

Medical:
- Personal medicines
- Pain relievers
- Bandages

Other:
- Umbrella
- Small bag
- Mobile phone
- Small Quran

Miqats are designated places for ihram:

Five Miqats:
1. Dhu al-Hulayfah: For Medina people
2. Al-Juhfah: For Levant and Maghreb
3. Qarn al-Manazil: For Najd people
4. Yalamlam: For Yemen people
5. Dhat Irq: For Iraq people

Special Miqats:
- Maghrebis: Rabigh
- From Medina: Dhu al-Hulayfah
- Inside Miqats: from their place

Pilgrim enters ihram at the Miqat they pass.

How to enter ihram step by step:

Before ihram:
- Remove unwanted hair
- Cut nails
- Perform ghusl
- Apply perfume (not on ihram clothes)

Ihram clothing:
- Men: White Izar and Rida
- Women: Covering non-provocative clothing
- Forbidden: niqab and gloves for women

Ihram prayer:
- Pray two rak'ahs
- Recite al-Kafirun then al-Ikhlas

Intention:
- Intend in heart
- Say: 'Labbayk Allahumma Hajjan' or 'Umratan'
- Begin Talbiyah

Permitted to enter ihram before Miqat.

Prohibitions during ihram:

Clothing:
- Wearing sewn clothes (men)
- Covering head (men)
- Wearing niqab and gloves (women)

Perfume:
- Using perfume
- Perfuming hair

Hair and nails:
- Shaving hair
- Cutting nails

Other:
- Marriage
- Intimacy
- Hunting
- Killing harmful insects

One who commits prohibition ignorantly is not at fault.

Talbiyah is Hajj's symbol:

Formula:
'Labbayk Allahumma labbayk, labbayk la sharika laka labbayk, inna al-hamda wa an-ni'mata laka wal-mulk, la sharika lak'

Rules:
- Obligatory once
- Recommended to repeat
- Men raise voice
- Women say softly

Times:
- Begins after ihram
- Continues always
- After prayers

Stopping Talbiyah:
- Ifrad and Qiran: at Haram entrance
- Tamattu': at Tawaf start
- All: after noon on Arafat day

One unable to say it is not at fault.

Ihram is a fundamental pillar:

Definition:
- Intention to enter rites
- With Talbiyah or Takbir
- Contract binding pilgrim

Validity conditions:
- Islam
- Intention
- Talbiyah
- Miqat

Types:
- Ifrad: Hajj only
- Qiran: Hajj and Umrah together
- Tamattu': Umrah then Hajj

Tamattu' and Qiran require sacrifice.

Standing at Arafat is the greatest pillar:

Status:
- Pillar of Hajj
- Without it, no Hajj

Time:
- Starts noon 9th Dhul-Hijjah
- Ends dawn of sacrifice day
- Minimum: one moment

Conditions:
- Be in prescribed time
- Be within Arafat boundaries
- Know one is at Arafat
- Have intention

How:
- Stand anywhere in Arafat
- Face Qibla
- Invoke Allah
- Multiply Talbiyah
- Combine Dhuhr and Asr

One who stands moment accomplished Hajj.

Tawaf al-Ifadah is a pillar:

Definition:
- Tawaf after Arafat
- Also called Tawaf az-Ziyarah

Status:
- Pillar of Hajj
- Without it, invalid Hajj

Time:
- Best: sacrifice day
- Permissible: dawn sacrifice to end Dhul-Hijjah
- Makeup: after with sacrifice

Conditions:
- Ritual purity
- Cover awrah
- Circle Kaaba
- Start at Black Stone
- Seven complete rounds
- Continuity

How:
- Start at Black Stone
- Keep Kaaba on left
- Walk fast first three (men)
- Pray two rak'ahs after

Sa'i is a Hajj pillar:

Status:
- Pillar of Hajj
- Cannot be compensated

Conditions:
- After valid Tawaf
- Start at Safa
- Seven complete rounds
- Continuity
- In usual Mas'a

How:
- Ascend Safa
- Face Qibla
- Make Takbir and invoke
- Descend to Marwah
- Walk fast between green markers (men)
- Ascend Marwah and invoke
- Return to Safa

Rounds:
- Safa to Marwah: one round
- Marwah to Safa: one round
- Starts Safa, ends Marwah

Sa'i valid at upper floors.

Spending night at Muzdalifah is obligatory:

Status:
- Obligatory per Malikis
- If omitted: sacrifice required
- Excused for valid reason

Time:
- After midnight until dawn
- Women and weak may leave after midnight

Activities:
- Stop there briefly
- Combine Maghrib and Isha
- Shorten Isha
- Collect pebbles
- Invoke Allah

Stay:
- Recommended not obligatory
- No sacrifice if omitted

Leave after Fajr before dawn.

Spending nights at Mina is obligatory:

Status:
- Obligatory for all
- If omitted: sacrifice required

Obligatory nights:
- Nights of 11th and 12th
- Night of 13th if staying
- Two nights if hastening

Time:
- Sunset to sunrise
- Sufficient: most of night
- Exit permitted for necessity

Activities:
- Stone three Jamarat after noon
- Invoke after stoning
- Worship Allah
- Fraternize with pilgrims

Omitting one or more nights: one sacrifice.

Stoning is obligatory:

Jamarat:
- Small Jamrah
- Middle Jamrah
- Jamrat al-Aqabah (large)

Days:
- Sacrifice day: Aqabah only (7 pebbles)
- Tashriq days: all three (21 pebbles/day)

Time:
- After noon
- Extends into night
- Night permitted for excuse

How:
- Throw seven pebbles per Jamrah
- Pebble by pebble with Takbir
- Stop to invoke (small and middle)
- Don't stop after Aqabah

Conditions:
- With pebbles
- By oneself if able
- Delegation permitted if unable
- Order: small, middle, large

Omission: sacrifice required.

Farewell Tawaf is obligatory:

Status:
- Obligatory per Malikis
- If omitted: sacrifice required
- Excused for menstruating women

Time:
- After all rites
- When leaving Mecca
- Last rite

Conditions:
- Ritual purity
- Cover awrah
- Seven rounds around Kaaba
- Continuity

How:
- Like Tawaf al-Ifadah
- No Ramal or Idtiba
- Pray two rak'ahs after
- Leave immediately

Cancelled by:
- Extended stay after
- Long worldly affairs
- Not cancelled by short shopping

Invoke to return to Mecca.

Common ihram mistakes:

Miqat errors:
- Passing Miqat without ihram
- Ihram before Miqat
- Not knowing correct Miqat

Clothing errors:
- Wearing sewn clothes (men)
- Covering head (men)
- Wearing niqab and gloves (women)
- Perfumed clothes

Perfume errors:
- Using perfume after ihram
- Perfuming hair
- Wearing perfumed clothes

Intention errors:
- No intention
- Saying intention aloud
- Not making Talbiyah

Other:
- Shaving or cutting nails
- Marriage during ihram
- Intimacy before first release

Learn ihram rules before.

Common Tawaf mistakes:

Condition errors:
- Tawaf without purity
- Uncovered awrah
- Tawaf inside Hijr

Start errors:
- Starting elsewhere than Black Stone
- Not touching or pointing to Stone
- Not keeping Kaaba on left

Round errors:
- Not completing seven rounds
- Doubting number
- Exceeding seven

Form errors:
- Ramal on all rounds
- Idtiba outside Tawaf al-Qudum
- Excessive talking
- Loud collective supplications

Two rak'ahs errors:
- Omitting them
- Praying elsewhere
- Not reciting in them

Time errors:
- Delaying Tawaf al-Ifadah
- Tawaf at forbidden times

Learn correct Tawaf form.

Common Sa'i mistakes:

Start errors:
- Starting at Marwah instead of Safa
- Not ascending Safa and Marwah
- Not facing Qibla

Round errors:
- Not completing seven
- Doubting number
- Counting incorrectly

Form errors:
- Omitting run between markers (men)
- Running at wrong place
- Riding without excuse
- Excessive talking

Time errors:
- Sa'i before Tawaf
- Sa'i after invalid Tawaf
- No continuity

Supplication errors:
- Collective supplications
- Loud disturbing voice
- Omitting prescribed supplications

Learn correct Sa'i form.

Common Arafat mistakes:

Place errors:
- Standing outside Arafat
- Believing must climb Mountain
- Forcing to specific places

Time errors:
- Leaving before sunset
- Arriving after sacrifice dawn
- Believing must be day and night

Form errors:
- Fasting on Arafat day (pilgrim)
- Busy with worldly affairs
- Not invoking
- Sleeping all time

Supplication errors:
- Raising hands disturbingly
- Collective supplications
- Only prescribed supplications
- Not invoking for Muslims

Prayer errors:
- Not combining Dhuhr and Asr
- Praying at wrong time
- Abandoning group prayer

Know all Arafat is station, best supplication: Arafat day.

Supplication entering Masjid al-Haram:

Entering:
- Enter right foot
- Say: 'I seek refuge with Allah'
- Say: 'In Allah's name, peace upon Messenger'
- Say: 'O Allah, open for me doors of Your mercy'

Seeing Kaaba:
- Say: 'O Allah, You are Peace'
- Say: 'O Allah, increase honor of this House'
- Raise hands and invoke

Recommended: pray two rak'ahs.

Supplications for each round:

First round:
'Glory be to Allah, praise be to Allah, no deity but Allah, Allah is greatest. No power nor strength except with Allah. Prayer and peace upon Allah's Messenger. O Allah, faith in You, belief in Your Book, fulfillment of Your covenant, following Your Prophet Muhammad's Sunnah. O Allah, I ask You for pardon, well-being, permanent wellness in religion, this world and hereafter, success in Paradise and deliverance from Fire'

Between corners:
'Our Lord, give us good in this world and hereafter, protect us from Fire's punishment'

Second round:
'O Allah, this House is Your House, sanctuary is Your sanctuary, security is Your security, servant is Your servant, I am Your servant son of Your servant. This is station of one seeking refuge in You from Fire. Protect our flesh and skin from Fire'

Third round:
'O Allah, I seek refuge in You from doubt, association, discord, hypocrisy, bad manners, bad return in wealth, family and children'

Multiply Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil and Takbir.

Sa'i supplications between Safa and Marwah:

On Safa:
- Ascend and face Qibla
- Say three times: 'Allah is greatest'
- Say: 'No deity but Allah alone without partner, His is sovereignty and praise, He is capable of all things'
- Invoke

First round:
'Allah is greatest, Allah is greatest, Allah is greatest, praise to Allah. Allah is very great, abundant praise to Allah, glory to Allah morning and evening. No deity but Allah alone, He fulfilled His promise, helped His servant and defeated coalitions alone'

Between green markers:
- Walk fast (men)
- Say: 'Lord, forgive and have mercy, efface and be generous, overlook what You know, for You know what we don't know, You are Most Powerful, Most Generous'

On Marwah:
- Do as on Safa
- Make Takbir, Tahlil and invoke

Repeat each round with more supplications.

Arafat day supplication:

Best supplication:
- 'No deity but Allah alone without partner, His is sovereignty and praise, He is capable of all things'
- Repeat often

Prescribed supplications:
'O Allah, to You praise as we say and better. O Allah, to You my prayer, my sacrifice, my life and death, to You my return, to You Lord my heritage. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from grave's punishment, chest's whispers and affairs' confusion. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from evil brought by wind'

Invoke:
- For oneself and parents
- For family
- For Muslims
- For forgiveness and well-being
- For Paradise
- To fulfill needs

Recommended:
- Raise hands
- Multiply forgiveness requests
- Cry and be humble
- Invoke with sincerity

Prophet said: 'Best supplication is Arafat day's.'
